title: Intel MKL ERROR with pytorch 0.3.0
body_html:
I installed pytorch in a virtual environment with conda (conda install pytorch torchvision -c pytorch).
When I execute e.g. the following code:

    import torch
    import numpy as np
    x = np.random.randint(0, 254, size=(5, 10))
    C = np.cov(x)

I get the following error:
Intel MKL ERROR: Parameter 10 was incorrect on entry to DSYRK

When I remove the import torch statement, the code executes without errors.
When I downgrade to pytorch 0.2.0 (conda install pytorch torchvision -c soumith), the code also executes without errors.

I am not sure how to find out the version of the Intel MKL on the system.

  • OS: CentOS Linux release 7.2.1511 (Core)
  • PyTorch version: 0.3.0
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda install pytorch torchvision -c pytorch
  • Python version: Python 3.6.3
  • CUDA/cuDNN version:
  • GPU models and configuration:
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): -

body:
I installed pytorch in a virtual environment with conda (`conda install pytorch torchvision -c pytorch`). 
When I execute e.g. the following code:
```
    import torch
    import numpy as np
    x = np.random.randint(0, 254, size=(5, 10))
    C = np.cov(x) 
```
I get the following error:
`Intel MKL ERROR: Parameter 10 was incorrect on entry to DSYRK `

When I remove the `import torch` statement, the code executes without errors.
When I downgrade to pytorch 0.2.0 (`conda install pytorch torchvision -c soumith`), the code also executes without errors.

I am not sure how to find out the version of the Intel MKL on the system.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
- OS: CentOS Linux release 7.2.1511 (Core)
- PyTorch version: 0.3.0
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): `conda install pytorch torchvision -c pytorch`
- Python version: Python 3.6.3
- CUDA/cuDNN version:
- GPU models and configuration:
- GCC version (if compiling from source): -
